name: National Democratic Institute for International Affairs
goal: NDI works on five continents with political parties, governments, parliaments and civic groups to establish and strengthen democratic institutions and practices. The Institute uses a multinational approach that reinforces the message that while there is no single democratic model, certain core principles are shared by all democracies. That philosophy has been applied in more than 130 countries since NDIâ€™s founding in 1983.
interests: External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: The Institute is primarily following the EU Commission's Democratic Change initiative, particularly around the conclusion of the Future of Europe process and the next policy areas for further democratizing the EU. The Institute is also following the Commission's initiative on Justice and Fundamental rights; keeping abreast with EU policy work on international gender equality, international human rights, and combating discrimination informs NDI's own work in these areas with our EU partners.
